ygData.subject: RE: Invisibility against undead (was End of Kiting?)
ygData.msgSnippet: If someone decides to write the advanced bard guide for EQVault it would be nice if the list of mobs with the innate ability to See Invisibility was also
ygData.messageBody:
If someone decides to write the advanced bard guide for EQVault it would be
nice if the list of mobs with the innate ability to See Invisibility was
also included. Would also be good to have this info in the Bard Song
analysis that is posted on someone's bard site (can't remember whose website
it is but Talies the Wanderer come to mind).

Galtin of E'ci

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas) [SMTP:Michael.Garramone@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, August 25, 1999 2:17 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Invisibility against undead (was End of
> Kiting?)
>
> From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>
>
> many mobs have the innate ability to see invis without having a spell cast
> on them. one example is the kobolds in solusek B. invis is uselss
> against
> them.
>
> Shada D'ukal, Level 50 Bard, Mithaniel Marr
> Erisi Dlarit, Level 21 Paladin, Mithaniel Marr
>
>
> > These leads into another question, John stated that sometimes
> > the hag casts
> > See Invisibility on the mobs and thats why they still attack
> > you when you
> > sing the song. What about other types of mobs? Do any
> > creatures out there
> > have the innate ability to See Invisibility or do they have
> > to also cast the
> > See Invisibility spell?
> >
> > Galtin of E'ci
> >
>
